definitions.definition: separate or cause to separate into pieces as a result of a blow, shock, or strain.
examples: the rope broke with a loud snap

definitions.definition: sustain an injury involving the fracture of a bone or bones in a part of the body.
examples: she had broken her leg in two places

definitions.definition: cause a cut or graze in (the skin).
examples: the bite had scarcely broken the skin
synonyms: perforate; cut "the bite had barely broken the skin"

definitions.definition: make or become inoperative.
examples: the machine has broken, and they can't fix it until next week
synonyms: give up the ghost "the coffee machine has broken"

definitions.definition: (of the amniotic fluid surrounding a fetus) be or cause to be discharged when the sac is ruptured in the first stages of labor.
examples: she realized her water had broken

definitions.definition: open (a safe) forcibly.
use (a piece of paper currency) to pay for something and receive change out of the transaction.
examples: she had to break a ten

definitions.definition: (of two boxers or wrestlers) come out of a clinch, typically at the referee's command.
examples: I was acting as referee and telling them to break

definitions.definition: unfurl (a flag or sail).
succeed in deciphering (a code).
examples: decipher, decode, decrypt, unravel, work out; Moreinformalfigure out, crack "he broke the encryption code"Morefigure out, crack he broke the encryption code

definitions.definition: open (a shotgun or rifle) at the breech.
disprove (an alibi).
invalidate (a will) through legal process.
interrupt (a continuity, sequence, or course).
examples: the new government broke the pattern of growth

definitions.definition: put an end to (a silence) by speaking or making contact.
make a pause in (a journey).
examples: we will break our journey in Venice

definitions.definition: stop proceedings in order to have a pause or vacation.
examples: at mid-morning they broke for coffee

definitions.definition: lessen the impact of (a fall).
examples: she put out an arm to break her fall
synonyms: take the edge off "a pile of carpets broke his fall"

definitions.definition: stop oneself from being subject to (a habit).
examples: give up, relinquish, drop; Moreinformalkick, shake, quit "habits are difficult to break"Morekick, shake, quit habits are difficult to break

definitions.definition: put an end to (a tie in a game) by making a score.
(chiefly of an attacking player or team, or of a military force) make a rush or dash in a particular direction.
examples: the flight broke to the right and formed a defensive circle

definitions.definition: surpass (a record).
examples: the movie broke box-office records

definitions.definition: disconnect or interrupt (an electrical circuit).
(of a pitched baseball) curve or drop on its way toward the batter.
(of the ball) rebound unpredictably.
examples: the ball broke to Craig but his shot rebounded from the post

definitions.definition: (of a bowled cricket ball) change direction on bouncing, due to spin.
fail to observe (a law, regulation, or agreement).
examples: the district attorney says she will prosecute retailers who break the law
synonyms: fly in the face of "traders who break the law"

definitions.definition: fail to continue with (a self-imposed discipline).
examples: diets started without preparation are broken all the time

definitions.definition: crush the emotional strength, spirit, or resistance of.
examples: the idea was to better the prisoners, not to break them

definitions.definition: (of a person's emotional strength) give way.
examples: her self-control finally broke
synonyms: go to pieces "her self-control finally broke"

definitions.definition: destroy the power of (a movement or organization).
examples: destroy, crush, quash, defeat, vanquish, overcome, overpower, overwhelm, suppress, cripple; Moreweaken, subdue, cow, undermine "the strategies used to break the union"Moreweaken, subdue, cow, undermine the strategies used to break the union

definitions.definition: destroy the effectiveness of (a strike), typically by bringing in other people to replace the striking workers.
tame or train (a horse).
undergo a change or enter a new state, in particular.
(of the weather) change suddenly.
examples: the weather broke, and thunder rumbled through a leaden sky

definitions.definition: (of a storm) begin violently.
(of dawn or day) begin with the sun rising.
examples: dawn was just breaking
synonyms: appear "the day broke fair and cloudless"

definitions.definition: (of clouds) move apart and begin to disperse.
(of waves) curl over and dissolve into foam.
examples: the Caribbean sea breaking gently on the shore

definitions.definition: (of the voice) falter and change tone, due to emotion.
examples: her voice broke as she relived the experience
synonyms: shake "her voice broke as she relived the experience"

definitions.definition: (of a boy's voice) change in tone and register at puberty.
(of a vowel) develop into a diphthong, under the influence of an adjacent sound.
examples: breaking due to a following r or h

definitions.definition: (of prices on the stock exchange) fall sharply.
(of news or a scandal) suddenly become public.
examples: since the news broke I've received thousands of wonderful letters

definitions.definition: make bad news known to someone.
examples: reveal, disclose, divulge, impart, tell; Moreannounce, release "he tried to break the news gently"Moreannounce, release he tried to break the news gently

definitions.definition: make the first stroke at the beginning of a game of billiards, pool, or snooker.
an interruption of continuity or uniformity.
examples: the magazine has been published without a break since 1950
synonyms: cessation "the magazine has been published without a break since 1950"

definitions.definition: an act of separating oneself from a state of affairs.
examples: a break with the past

definitions.definition: a change in the weather.
examples: change, alteration, variation a break in the weather

definitions.definition: a change of line, paragraph, or page.
examples: dotted lines on the screen show page breaks

definitions.definition: a curve or drop in the path of a pitched baseball.
a change of tone in the voice due to emotion.
examples: there was a break in her voice now

definitions.definition: an interruption in an electrical circuit.
a rush or dash in a particular direction, especially by an attacking player or team.
examples: he made a bounce pass for a basket on the break in the second quarter

definitions.definition: a breakout, especially from prison.
a sudden decrease, typically in prices.
an opportunity or chance, especially one leading to professional success.
examples: his big break came when a critic gave him a rave review
synonyms: opening "the actress got her first break in 1951"

definitions.definition: the winning of a game against an opponent's serve.
examples: noun: break of serve; plural noun: breaks of serve

definitions.definition: a pause in work or during an activity or event.
examples: I need a break from mental activity
synonyms: down time; coffee break "let's have a break"

definitions.definition: a short vacation.
examples: the Christmas break

definitions.definition: a short solo or instrumental passage in jazz or popular music.
a gap or opening.
examples: the spectacular vistas occasionally offered by a break in the rain forest

definitions.definition: an instance of breaking; the point where something is broken.
examples: a break in the valve was being repaired

definitions.definition: a player's turn to make the opening shot of a game or a rack.
a consecutive series of successful shots, scoring a specified number of points.
examples: a break of 83 put him in front for the first time
